definition[0]: to begin or to start something
example[0]: Work will commence on the new building immediately.
example[1]: Your first evaluation will be six months after you commence employment.
example[2]: The course commences with a one week introduction to Art Theory.
example[3]: The planes commenced bombing at midnight.
explanation[0]: In everyday English, people usually say start rather than commence:
example[4]: The concert was just about to start.
